briefTitle: Safety and Efficacy Study of Several Replagal Dosing Regimens on Cardiac Function in Adults With Fabry Disease

armGroups.label: Replagal 0.2 mg/kg, IV, every other week

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline to Month 12 in Left Ventricular Mass Indexed to Height (LVMI)
outcomeMeasures.description: Left ventricular mass (LVM) was measured through echocardiography.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline to Month 12 in Maximal Oxygen Consumption (VO2 Max) at Peak Exercise
outcomeMeasures.description: Exercise tolerance as measured by VO2 max at peak exercise using the standard exponential exercise protocol (STEEP).

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline to Month 12 in Distance Walked in 6-Minute Walk Test (6MWT)
outcomeMeasures.description: Exercise tolerance using the 6MWT was measured as the total distance walked in 6 minutes.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline to Month 12 in the Minnesota Living With Heart Failure Questionnaire (MLHF-Q) Summary Score
outcomeMeasures.description: Quality of life (QoL) was evaluated using the MLHF-Q, version 2. The questionnaire is designed to assess the degree to which heart failure symptoms affect a patient's daily life. The summary score ranges from 0 to 105, with a score of 105 representing the highest adverse impact on a patient's QoL.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline to Month 12 in New York Heart Association (NYHA) Functional Class
outcomeMeasures.description: The NYHA functional classification system relates symptoms to everyday activities and the patient's quality of life. NYHA Classification - The Stages of Heart Failure: Class I (Mild): No limitation of physical activity. Ordinary physical activity does not cause undue fatigue, palpitation, or dyspnea (shortness of breath). Class II (Mild): Slight limitation of physical activity. Comfortable at rest, but ordinary physical activity results in fatigue, palpitation, or dyspnea. Class III (Moderate): Marked limitation of physical activity. Comfortable at rest, but less than ordinary activity causes fatigue, palpitation, or dyspnea. Class IV (Severe): Unable to carry out any physical activity without discomfort. Symptoms of cardiac insufficiency at rest. If any physical activity is undertaken, discomfort is increased.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline to Month 12 in Plasma Globotriaosylceramide (GB3)
Change From Baseline to Month 12 in Estimated Glomerular Filtration Rate (eGFR)
outcomeMeasures.description: Renal function was assessed by an evaluation of change from baseline to Month 12 in eGFR as calculated using the Modification of Diet for Renal Disease (MDRD) equation.

outcomeMeasures.title: Change From Baseline to Month 12 in Urinary Albumin/Creatinine (A/Cr) Ratio
Safety Evaluation
outcomeMeasures.description: Adverse events were collected throughout the study, from the time of informed consent to approximately 30 days post-final infusion.
